results.description: Combines returns and time-series zscore. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using rsk62_1_return; SUGGESTION2 not applicable (scalar); SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage=1.0); SUGGESTION4 satisfied (high userCount). Confidence: 0.78.
Mean-revert short momentum using 5-return average. Used rsk62_5_return (SUGGESTION1). Vector ops not needed. Coverage=1.0 so no backfill. Confidence: 0.72.
Scale short momentum by risk. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_risk_volatility per SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4. Both have high coverage, no backfill. Confidence: 0.80.
Long momentum via 60-day returns. Uses rsk62_1_return; simple and widely used (SUGGESTION4). Coverage=1.0. Confidence: 0.75.
Use ts_ir to measure persistence of returns. SUGGESTION1 applied with rsk62_1_return; high userCount. Confidence: 0.73.
Vector retseries wrapped with vec_avg per SUGGESTION2. Used rsk62_retseries_factor_5_100_val4 (coverage=1.0). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.68.
Average industry return series indicates industry trend. Used rsk62_retseries_industry_1_100_val1 (vec -> vec_avg). SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence: 0.70.
Long stocks with high specific risk (expecting risk premium). Uses rsk62_1_100_ksrs (SUGGESTION1, high userCount). Coverage high. Confidence: 0.55.
Opposite of previous: prefer low specific risk. Used rsk62_1_100_ksrs. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.56.
Combine returns with log(adv20) risk to avoid illiquid names. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_risk_logadv20 (SUGGESTION1,SUGGESTION4). Confidence: 0.74.
Subtract industry return to get stock-specific momentum. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_industry_1_100_val1 (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high. Confidence: 0.76.
Cross-sectionally rank recent returns. Uses rsk62_1_return and quantile via zscore. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.77.
Reverse very short returns expecting reversal. Uses rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 simple; high coverage. Confidence: 0.69.
Use ts_max_diff on returns to find breakouts. Uses rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.62.
Combine returns and book value beta to favor low PB momentum. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_1_100_pb (high userCount, SUGGESTION4). Confidence: 0.70.
Scale momentum by eps growth beta. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_1_100_growth (coverage=1.0, high userCount). Confidence: 0.71.
Favor momentum in dividend payers. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_risk_backfill_dividend (SUGGESTION1,SUGGESTION4). Coverage high. Confidence: 0.66.
Use current ratio beta to favor financially stable companies. Uses rsk62_beta_1_100_curratio (high userCount). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.60.
Normalize returns cross-sectionally to remove industry bias. Uses rsk62_1_return and normalize operator (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.74.
Apply hump to momentum to reduce turnover (practical implementation). Uses ts_decay via hump on returns (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.68.
Use earnings per share factor and returns. rsk62_beta_factor_5_100_spe and rsk62_1_return used (SUGGESTION1,SUGGESTION4). Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum weighted by net income per employee
results.description: Use nipe to tilt toward operationally efficient companies. rsk62_risk_nipe and rsk62_1_return used (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.61.
Subtract factor return from stock return to find alpha. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_factor_1_100_val100 (high userCount). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.67.
Ratio of stock return to industry return to capture relative strength. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_industry_1_100_val1. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.72.
Smooth returns via ts_mean to reduce noise. Uses rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1, coverage=1.0). Confidence: 0.69.
ts_corr between stock returns and leading factor. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_factor_1_100_val34 (both high coverage). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.64.
Prefer stocks with steady positive momentum via inverse of ts_std_dev of returns. Uses rsk62_1_return and ts_std_dev (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.66.
Use vec_avg on factor retseries to capture prevailing factor direction. Used rsk62_retseries_factor_5_100_val15 (SUGGESTION2). Confidence: 0.65.
Rank stocks by recent volatility; prefer low-vol. Uses rsk62_risk_volatility and zscore. SUGGESTION4 used. Confidence: 0.59.
Subtract scaled volatility from momentum. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_risk_volatility. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.70.
Use group-neutral idea approximated by subtracting industry return. Uses rsk62_industry_1_100_val1 and rsk62_1_return. KEEP_IN_MIND4 considered (we don't use group operator). Confidence: 0.68.
Use ts_delta on factor returns representing EPS growth. Uses rsk62_factor_1_100_val25 (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0. Confidence: 0.62.
Reverse recent returns for low PB names using rsk62_beta_1_100_pb and rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION4 used for beta. Confidence: 0.60.
Only trade momentum when dividend date index signals recent payout. Uses trade_when with rsk62_dividend_di and rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.58.
Use ts_kurtosis to avoid fat-tail momentum. Uses rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.54.
Winsorize returns to reduce outlier noise. Uses rsk62_1_return and winsorize (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.71.
Scale returns by logadv20 risk to avoid low liquidity. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_risk_logadv20. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.73.
Difference between two factor returns to detect regime shifts. Uses rsk62_factor_1_100_val34 and rsk62_factor_1_100_val35. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence: 0.60.

ts_zscore on factor return series to capture factor momentum. Uses rsk62_retseries_factor_5_100_val2 (vec -> vec_avg optional, but ts_zscore used). SUGGESTION2 applied where appropriate. Confidence: 0.66.
ts_arg_max on industry retseries to detect recent leadership. Uses rsk62_retseries_industry_5_100_val20 (SUGGESTION2). Confidence: 0.63.
Apply ts_decay_linear on returns to smooth momentum signal. Uses rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.67.
ts_delta of ts_returns captures acceleration. Uses rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.61.
Sum vector factor returns to compute net factor move. Uses rsk62_retseries_factor_5_100_val11 wrapped with vec_sum (SUGGESTION2). Confidence: 0.60.
vec_stddev of factor retseries to measure dispersion. Uses rsk62_retseries_factor_5_100_val9 (SUGGESTION2). Confidence: 0.58.
Scale returns by gross margin beta to tilt to profitable momentum. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_1_100_margin (high userCount). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.64.
If recent kurtosis high, trade reversal. Uses ts_kurtosis and rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.55.
Subtract common intercept factor from returns to remove market bias. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_1_100_intercept. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence: 0.69.

results.idea: Short-term mean reversion scaled by size
results.description: Prefer reversion in small caps using logcap beta. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_1_100_logcap. SUGGESTION4 used. Confidence: 0.63.
Compare short vs long returns to find change in trend. Uses rsk62_1_return for both horizons. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.70.

results.idea: EPS growth vs factor return divergence
results.description: ts_corr between EPS-growth factor and stock returns to detect divergence. Uses rsk62_factor_1_100_val25 and rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.58.
Tilt to sectors with positive expected industry returns. Uses rsk62_industry_1_100_val100 (industry fields). SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.65.
Use ts_quantile of returns to produce robust ranking. Uses rsk62_1_return and ts_quantile (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.72.

results.idea: Short-term pair mean reversion via factor spread
results.description: Subtract factor return from stock return and reverse expecting reversion. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_factor_1_100_val34. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.59.
Use winsorize on industry returns then momentum. Uses rsk62_industry_1_100_val1 and rsk62_1_return. Coverage=1.0 so backfill not needed. Confidence: 0.66.
If volatility low then expect breakout; use inverse volatility * recent returns. Uses rsk62_risk_volatility and rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.60.
Backfill dividend info if sparse, then apply momentum only if dividend present. rsk62_risk_backfill_dividend used with rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION3 applied where coverage<1). Confidence: 0.57.
Reduce turnover by limiting changes via hump on momentum signal. Uses ts_returns and hump (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.68.
Approximate industry neutral by subtracting industry zscore. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_industry_1_100_val1. KEEP_IN_MIND4 considered and we avoid group operator. Confidence: 0.71.
Require momentum persistence via ts_delay confirmation. Uses ts_returns and ts_delay on rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.65.
Rank companies by gross margin beta to prefer quality. Uses rsk62_risk_margin (high userCount). SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.62.
Downweight momentum when intercept factor is large (common move). Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_1_100_intercept. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.66.
Subtract industry average factor from factor to find divergence. Uses rsk62_factor_1_100_val34 and rsk62_industry_1_100_val1. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.59.
Use ts_step / day counter with returns to capture seasonal days; implemented via ts_step and multiply by returns. Uses rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.50.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by short-term momentum beta
results.description: Use short-term momentum beta to emphasize persistent names. Uses rsk62_beta_1_100_mts and rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION4). Confidence: 0.67.
Scale returns by eps growth risk. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_1_100_growth (SUGGESTION4). Confidence: 0.65.
ts_covariance between stock returns and a factor to measure co-movement. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_factor_1_100_val34. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.60.
Use sign() of returns to capture persistent direction. Uses rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 simple. Confidence: 0.58.
Fade extreme 1-day moves by reversing winsorized returns. Uses rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.64.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by net income per employee beta
results.description: Tilt momentum to operational efficiency using rsk62_beta_1_100_nipe and rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION4 used. Confidence: 0.62.
Bucket recent returns into deciles for portfolio construction. Uses ts_returns and bucket (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.70.
Approximate group normalization by dividing by industry mean return. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_industry_1_100_val1. KEEP_IN_MIND4 noted; we avoid group operator. Confidence: 0.68.
ts_max_diff identifies drawdowns; reverse sign to mean-revert. Uses rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.63.
If stock has recent maximum returns (ts_arg_max==0) then long. Uses ts_arg_max on returns (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.61.
Find names with short momentum opposite long-term trend. Uses rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.66.
Subtract factor return to get residual alpha. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_factor_1_100_val100. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.68.
Use vec_avg on industry retseries to get industry-level momentum. Uses rsk62_retseries_industry_1_100_val11 (SUGGESTION2). Confidence: 0.64.
zscore of winsorized returns to be robust. Uses rsk62_1_return and winsorize (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.73.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by beta to volatility factor
results.description: Divide returns by factor volatility beta to prefer stable exposure. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_1_100_volatility. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.65.
Use leading factor return as signal to trade correlated stocks. Uses rsk62_factor_1_100_val100 and ts_corr with returns. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by market intercept shrinkage
results.description: Reduce momentum exposure when intercept is large using divide. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_1_100_intercept. SUGGESTION4 used. Confidence: 0.66.

results.idea: Short-term reversal after high group-count days
results.description: If many NaNs recently (ts_count_nans) then reduce trading; uses rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION3 not needed. Confidence: 0.52.
Scale momentum in time series space to [0,1] via ts_scale. Uses rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.68.
Cross-sectional zscore on factor return to pick extremes. Uses rsk62_factor_1_100_val100 (high userCount). SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum multiplied by industry expected return
results.description: Tilt stock momentum by expected industry return. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_industry_5_100_val79. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence: 0.67.
Divide momentum by its recent stddev to prefer stable winners. Uses rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1. Confidence: 0.69.
Pasteurize returns to remove INF/outliers before ranking. Uses rsk62_1_return and pasteurize (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.66.

results.idea: Momentum lag vs industry lag difference
results.description: Compare delayed returns of stock and industry to detect relative shifts. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_industry_1_100_val1. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum suppressed by high group-count proxy
results.description: When industry has many valid instruments (group_count proxy) reduce concentration; we approximate via industry field count (KEEP_IN_MIND4 avoided). Uses rsk62_industry_1_100_val1 and rsk62_1_return. Confidence: 0.55.
ts_av_diff finds deviation from long-term mean; reverse to mean-revert. Uses rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.67.
Product of short returns to detect compounding momentum. Uses ts_product on rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1. Confidence: 0.54.
Rank returns into Gaussian quantiles to construct bets. Uses ts_returns and quantile (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.72.
zscore of ts_delta of returns to capture accelerating moves. Uses rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.60.
Winsorize (stock return - factor) then rank. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_factor_1_100_val100. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.66.

results.idea: Momentum combined with book value backfill
results.description: Use risk_backfill_pb to ensure PB coverage and scale momentum. Applies SUGGESTION3 where coverage<1 if needed; here backfill used. Confidence: 0.63.
Prefer momentum in high adv20 names to reduce slippage using rsk62_risk_logadv20. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.72.
Scale returns in time to remove regime effects via ts_scale. Uses rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.69.
Prefer winners with low volatility by multiplying momentum with inverse volatility. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_risk_volatility. SUGGESTION1/SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.71.
Rank each instrument's recent returns in its time series (persistence). Uses ts_rank on rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.65.
Use vec_range of industry retseries to detect dispersion in industry returns. Uses rsk62_retseries_industry_5_100_val3 (SUGGESTION2). Confidence: 0.58.
Downweight momentum for highly levered names using rsk62_risk_qe2d. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.60.
If current day is recent minimum, expect bounce (mean-revert). Uses ts_arg_min on returns. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.56.
Add multiple factor returns to form composite factor momentum. Uses two factor fields (SUGGESTION1). Both coverage=1.0. Confidence: 0.61.

results.idea: Return momentum with pasteurize and winsorize
results.description: Clean returns via pasteurize then winsorize before ranking. Uses rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.70.
Subtract long-term factor trend from short stock momentum. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_factor_1_100_val100. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.62.
Only trade momentum if industry intercept low (less common move). Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_1_100_intercept. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by beta to mining industry
results.description: Tilt momentum for exposure to mining specific beta. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_1_100_mining (SUGGESTION4). Confidence: 0.57.
zscore of sign(ts_returns) to detect persistent direction. Uses rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.55.
ts_corr between two factors to identify regime shifts. Uses rsk62_factor_1_100_val34 and rsk62_factor_1_100_val35. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.58.
Combine return momentum with gross margin zscore to favor quality winners. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_risk_margin. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.69.
Winsorize returns then quantile for robust cross-sectional ranks. Uses rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.73.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_backfill for low-coverage beta
results.description: If using low coverage industry beta, backfill then use momentum. Applies SUGGESTION3; example uses rsk62_beta_industry_constr_5_100_computers (coverage<0.6) and rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.50.

results.idea: Vectorized factor momentum with vec_avg and ts_zscore
results.description: Use vec_avg on factor retseries then ts_zscore for robust factor signal. Uses rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val14 (SUGGESTION2). Confidence: 0.64.
Apply linear decay to reduce weight of older returns. Uses ts_returns and ts_decay_linear on rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.67.
Multiply momentum by inverse PB beta to combine value and momentum. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_1_100_pb. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.68.
Reduce changes using hump on composite signal. Uses hump and ts_returns (SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.66.
Cross-sectional zscore of a factor to pick extremes. Uses rsk62_factor_1_100_val92 (high alphaCount). SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by intercept of 5/100 model
results.description: Use rsk62_5_100_intercept to remove 5/100 common moves from 5-day returns. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum combined with beta to semiconductors
results.description: Favor momentum in names with positive semiconductor beta when that sector leads. Uses rsk62_beta_1_100_semiconductors and rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.55.

results.idea: Vectorized industry avg momentum minus stock
results.description: Subtract vec_avg(industry retseries) from stock returns to isolate idiosyncratic momentum. Uses rsk62_retseries_industry_1_100_val11 and rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION2 & 1). Confidence: 0.66.
Avoid trading if data sparse recently using ts_count_nans. Uses rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION3 considered but coverage=1 so not needed; still used for robustness. Confidence: 0.54.

results.idea: Factor alpha capture via ts_regression residual
results.description: Use ts_regression residual between stock returns and factor to find alpha. Uses ts_regression with rsk62_1_return and rsk62_factor_1_100_val100. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.60.
Prefer momentum in low specific risk names by dividing by ksrs. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_1_100_ksrs. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum weighted by industry expected returns
results.description: Multiply stock returns by expected industry returns to tilt to attractive industries. Uses rsk62_1_return and rsk62_industry_1_100_val100. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.67.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by long-term momentum beta
results.description: Use long-term momentum beta to favor persistent winners. Uses rsk62_beta_1_100_mtl and rsk62_1_return. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.69.

results.idea: Return momentum scaled by net income per employee backfill
results.description: Use backfilled nipe to ensure coverage and tilt momentum. Uses rsk62_risk_backfill_nipe and rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION3 applied for robustness). Confidence: 0.61.
